ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Parent Child Interaction (PCI), a naturalistic setting in which a child's behavior is measured with regard to his or her parent.
A count of the number of entrances into the Center zone during the PCI. The Center zone = the location of a set of toys
The total amount of time spent in the Center zone during the PCI. The Center zone = the location of a set of toys
The time it takes, starting from the beginning of the PCI, for the child to enter the Center zone. The Center zone = the location of a set of toys
A count of the number of entrances into the Parent zone during the PCI. Parent zone = a seated parent
The total amount of time spent in the Parent zone during the PCI. Parent zone = a seated parent
The time it takes, starting from the beginning of the PCI, for the child to enter the Parent zone. Parent zone = a seated parent
A count of the number of entrances into the Periphery zone during the PCI. Periphery zone = peripheral areas
The total amount of time spent in the Periphery zone during the PCI. Periphery zone = peripheral areas
The time it takes, starting from the beginning of the PCI, for the child to enter the Periphery zone. Periphery zone = peripheral areas
The average distance, in centimeters, between the child and the parent across the duration of the recording
